This project seeks to develop an alternative theory of moral progress that breaks free from the constraints of our inherited psychology. Building on the "expanding circle" account of moral progress, this research aims to overcome these limitations by exploring different forms of moral progress, moral attitudes that are not subject to evolutionary constraints, and the role of "smart" institutions in fostering moral development. Specifically, we will investigate how to transcend ethically arbitrary features such as class, age, gender, ethnicity, religion, and species membership, which often serve as barriers to moral inclusion. By challenging these boundaries, our goal is to develop a more comprehensive theory of moral progress that can guide efforts to extend moral concern to all individuals, regardless of their social group or characteristic. Ultimately, this project seeks to provide a framework for achieving a more inclusive and just society.
